description: Enjoy this One-Pan Apple Cider Glazed Chicken, a sweet and tangy dish that’s perfect for weeknight dinners. Impress your family with its delightful flavors!
instructions: In a bowl, mix apple cider, soy sauce, and Dijon mustard.
Heat olive oil in a large oven-safe skillet over medium-high heat.
Season chicken thighs with salt and pepper, then brown them in the skillet for about 5 minutes on each side.
Pour the apple cider mixture over the chicken and bring to a simmer.
Transfer the skillet to the oven and bake for 25 minutes, or until the chicken is cooked through.
Garnish with fresh thyme before serving.
tips: For best results, ensure the chicken is browned well for added flavor. Use a meat thermometer to check for doneness; chicken should reach 165°F. Let the chicken rest for a few minutes before serving to retain juices.

structured_content.content:
Initial Setup:
Preheat the oven to 400°F (200°C). Mix apple cider, soy sauce, and Dijon mustard in a bowl.
Main Cooking Phase:
Heat olive oil in a large oven-safe skillet, season chicken thighs, and brown for 5 minutes on each side. Pour the apple cider mixture over the chicken and bring to a simmer.
Final Assembly:
Transfer the skillet to the oven and bake for 25 minutes. Garnish with fresh thyme before serving.

note.label: Essential Knowledge
note.content:
• For maximum flavor, marinate the chicken in the glaze for a few hours before cooking.
  • Avoid overcrowding the skillet to ensure even browning.
  • Chicken is done when it reaches an internal temperature of 165°F.
  • Leftovers can be stored in the fridge for up to 3 days.

structured_content.content: Sharing this dish with family brings warmth and joy to our table. The sweet and tangy glaze always gets compliments, making it a favorite for gatherings.
Add a splash of apple cider vinegar for extra tang, or include sliced apples in the skillet for a fruity twist. A sprinkle of crushed red pepper flakes can add a hint of heat.
Serve with roasted vegetables or creamy mashed potatoes to soak up the delicious glaze. A side salad adds freshness to balance the meal.
Substitute chicken thighs with drumsticks or breasts, adjusting cooking time as needed. For a vegetarian option, use firm tofu and adjust the glaze accordingly.

  • Timing is key; check the chicken early to avoid overcooking.
  • Plate with a sprig of thyme for a professional touch.
